msg.text: The system requires a Role marked as the default. To deselect this Role as the default, set a different Role as default.
msg.action: Save the changes to this Role, then display the Role you want to make the default and set the checkbox.
msg.reason: The system requires one and only one Role marked as default. The only way to deselect a Role as default is to set a different Role as the default Role.

msg.text: The system requires a Tenant marked as the Service Provider. To deselect this Tenant as the Service Provider, set a different Tenant as the Service Provider.

msg.reason: The system requires one and only one Tenant marked as Service Provider. The only way to deselect a Tenant as the Service Provider is to set a different Tenant as the Service Provider.

msg.action: Remove all spaces from the prefix and resave.

msg.text: %1 Request Area or Category not serviced during this time
msg.action: Review the Workshifts associated with the Request Area or Category.
msg.reason: The Request Area or Category was enabled for Auto Assignment processing. However the Request Area or Category is constrained to only be processed during the associated Workshifts. The Open Date of the Request or Change Order does not fall within any of the associated Workshifts.

msg.text: %1 Request Area, Category or Workflow Template has no Groups to service this Request, Change Order, Issue or Task
msg.action: Associate Groups with the Request Area, Category or Workflow Template.

msg.action: Add Contacts to the Groups associated with the Workflow Template for the Task
msg.reason: After analyzing the Groups Associated with the Workflow Template for the Task, no Contacts were found.

msg.text: %1 Affected End User is required for Auto Assignment
msg.action: Please choose an Affected End User.
msg.reason: A Save or Close operation was initiated for the Request, Change Order or Issue, however the Request, Change Order or Issue has no Affected End User.

msg.text: %1 No eligible Request Area or Category Locations that service Affected End User's Location
msg.action: Review the Locations that are associated with the Request Area or Category.
msg.reason: The Request Area or Category was enabled for Auto Assignment processing. But the Request Area or Category is constrained to only process the associated Locations. The Affected End User's Location is not one of the Locations associated with the Request Area or Category.

msg.text: %1 Request Area or Category has Locations, but Affected End User has no Location
msg.action: Assign a Location to the Affected End User.
msg.reason: The Request Area or Category was enabled for Auto Assignment processing. But the Request Area or Category is constrained to only process the associated Locations. The Affected End User has no Location assigned. Auto Assignment could not determine if it should process this Affected End User because it had no Location.

msg.text: %1 No eligible Request Area or Category Locations that service Asset's Location
msg.action: Review the Locations that are associated with the Request Area or Category.
msg.reason: The Request Area or Category was enabled for Auto Assignment processing. But the Request Area or Category is constrained to only process the associated Locations. The Asset's Location is not one of the Locations associated with the Request Area or Category.

msg.text: %1 Request Area or Category has Locations, but Asset has no Location
msg.action: Assign a Location to the Asset.
msg.reason: The Request Area or Category was enabled for Auto Assignment processing. But the Request Area or Category is constrained to only process the associated Locations. The Asset has no Location assigned. Auto Assignment could not determine if it should process this Asset because it had no Location.

msg.action: Review the Workshifts assigned as the Work Schedules of the Groups associated with the Request Area or Category.
msg.reason: The Request Area or Category was enabled for Auto Assignment processing. Auto Assignment found no Groups that were eligible to for Assignment because the Open Date of the Request was outside of the Workshifts assigned as the Groups' Work Schedules.

msg.text: %1 No eligible Groups found to service this Request, Change Order, Issue or Task
msg.action: Review the Locations associated with the Groups that are associated to the Request Area or Category.
msg.reason: The Request Area or Category was enabled for Auto Assignment processing. The Groups that Auto Assignment determined were eligible for servicing this Request, Change Order, Issue or Task are constrained to process only the Locations associated with the Groups. The Affected End User's or Asset's Location is not serviced by and of the Groups that were determined eligible.

msg.action: Review the Available flag and Workshift assigned as the Work Schedule of the Analysts that are members of the Groups associated with the Request Area or Category.
msg.reason: The Request Area or Category was enabled for Auto Assignment processing. No Analyst were found after filtering all eligible Groups. The Analysts in the eligible Groups where either unavailable or the Open Date of the Request was outside of the Workshift assigned as the Analyst's Work Schedule.

The Request Area, Category or Workflow Template were enabled for Auto Assignment, but no eligible assignee was found .

msg.action: "The values for the fields that are Accumulated (such as Cost and Duration) may have bad values, or a system error occurred. Inspect the children Change Orders. Perform actions 1 and 5 if problem persists."
msg.reason: An error prevented an Accumulate action on one or more children.
Service Desk requires changes to a Request be saved before creating a new Change Order.

msg.text: The %1 must be saved and have a Category specified before you can do this.
The Issue must be saved and have a Category specified before you can do this.
msg.reason: The Change Order must be saved and have a Category specified before you can do this.

msg.action: On the Activity Notification detail, place a check in the Auto Notifications box.
msg.reason: The Activity Notification is effectively disabled because the Auto Notification checkbox is unchecked. Verify this by opening the Activity Notification detail for the Activity in question (i.e. Manual Notify).

msg.text: You cannot set a child of this Change Order to be the parent.
You cannot set a child of this Issue to be the parent.
msg.reason: You cannot create a cyclical relationship between two change orders by setting a Change Order to be both a parent and a child of another Change Order.
msg.action: Select a different parent Change Order, or remove the the desired Order from the children list.

msg.text: You cannot set a child of this Request to be the parent.
msg.reason: You cannot create a cyclical relationship between two change orders by setting a Request to be both a parent and a child of another Request.
msg.action: Select a different parent Request, or remove the the desired Request from the children list.

msg.text: A loop is detected among the parent/child relationships involving Request '%1'. A child Request cannot be the parent (or grandparent, great grandparent, etc.) of its own parent.
msg.reason: A loop is detected among the parent/child relationships. For instance, say Request 3 is the parent of Request 2, and Request 2 is the parent of Request 1. Request 1 cannot be the parent of Request 2 or 3 or a 'loop' results. Service Desk enforces 'proper' family relationships - a child Request cannot be a parent of its own ancestors.
msg.action: Remove the loop by adjusting the values in the Parent Number field on the Request Relations tab. The Request List may help you identify the loop as the parent of each Request is listed.

msg.text: A loop is detected among the parent/child relationships involving %1 '%2'. A child %1 cannot be the parent (or grandparent, great grandparent, etc.) of its own parent.
A loop is detected among the parent/child relationships involving Issue '%1'. A child Issue cannot be the parent (or grandparent, great grandparent, etc.) of its own parent.
msg.reason: A loop is detected among the parent/child relationships. For instance, say Change Order 3 is the parent of Change Order 2, and Change Order 2 is the parent of Change Order 1. Change Order 1 cannot be the parent of Change Order 2 or 3 or a 'loop' results. Service Desk enforces 'proper' family relationships - a child Change Order cannot be a parent of its own ancestors.
msg.action: Remove the loop by adjusting the values in the Parent Number field on the Request Relations tab. The Request List may help you identify the loop as the parent of each Request is listed.

msg.text: You've selected a large number of Assets to add or remove. This action may take a while. Do you wish to continue?
You've selected a large number of Items to add or remove. This action may take a while. Do you wish to continue?
msg.action: The client may temporarily slow down, but should speed back up again.
msg.reason: Adding/removing a large amount of items can impact system performance on the client.

msg.text: Cannot delete the selected task status.
msg.action: Select a different task status to delete. Choose one that is not shipped with the product.
msg.reason: If the user accidentally deletes a default Workflow Task Status from the GUI, it would be very difficult to put that task status back into the database.

msg.text: Cannot delete the selected task type.
msg.action: Select a different task type to delete. Choose one that is not shipped with the product.
msg.reason: If the user accidentally deletes a default Workflow Task Type from the GUI, it would be very difficult to put that task type back into the database.

msg.text: Cannot insert task - no room left between sequence numbers.
msg.action: Add the task in a different location or delete tasks to make room. When designing Workflow Task Templates, use greater differences between sequence numbers.
msg.reason: All Workflow Tasks must have a unique integer sequence number; Tasks are ordered by ascending sequence numbers. User is trying to insert a Workflow Task between two Tasks with successive sequence numbers (e.g. 23 and 24).

msg.text: No topology.cfg file entry for node; queuing event
msg.action: "Edit the $NX_ROOT/site/eh/topology.cfg file and add a line for the client Event Converter (CA Unicenter NSM), pause the Event Converter on the client, restart the server with pdm_halt and pdm_init and then resume the Event Converter on the client."
msg.reason: There is no entry in the server's $NX_ROOT/site/eh/topology.cfg file to indicate this client will connect and send events to a local service.

msg.text: No topology.cfg file entry for node; queue full, dropping event - %1
msg.action: "Edit the $NX_ROOT/site/eh/topology.cfg file and add a line for the client Event Converter (CA Unicenter NSM), pause the Event Converter on the client, restart the server with pdm_halt and pdm_init and then resume the Event Converter on the client."
msg.reason: "There is no entry in the server's $NX_ROOT/site/eh/topology.cfg file to indicate this client will connect and send events to a local service, but the Event Converter has queued events locally and the queue is full. Further events are lost."

msg.text: Queue half full, will drop events soon!
msg.action: "Edit the $NX_ROOT/site/eh/topology.cfg file and add a line for the client Event Converter (CA Unicenter NSM), pause the Event Converter on the client, restart the server with pdm_halt and pdm_init and then resume the Event Converter on the client."
msg.reason: "This is a warning that events are being queued, because the server has no entry in the $NX_ROOT/site/eh/topology.cfg file for the client, and the queue is half full."

msg.text: Queue nearly full, will drop events soon!
msg.action: "Edit the $NX_ROOT/site/eh/topology.cfg file and add a line for the client Event Converter (CA Unicenter NSM), pause the Event Converter on the client, restart the server with pdm_halt and pdm_init and then resume the Event Converter on the client."
msg.reason: "This is a warning that events are being queued, because the server has no entry in the $NX_ROOT/site/eh/topology.cfg file for the client, and the queue is nearly full."

msg.text: This utility reindexes knowledge documents and updates search-related settings.
+f - create index and dictionary files only
file:reindex.txt - if the parameter is presented, documents will be indexed to the text file instead of indexing into the database
+t - switch the names of search and reindex tables only
stdout:100 - log statistics to the command window for every 100 documents indexed
All parameters are optional. If none are presented, a full reindex is done.
Running post migration (look at the stdlog for progress) ...
This utility is used to selectively re-index, de-index and synchronize (re-index and de-index) document factories: KD, cr, iss, etc.
Note: if no arguments being selected the KD factory will be indexed
sync - re-index and/or de-index documents to synchronize search engine after purge or restore being executed
status - show a count of remaining documents to process
factory:all|KD|cr|iss - sets the factory or all factories to process
clearrange (optional) - de-index documents that are out of the predefined range of the factory
Note: factory is required with deindex parameter
There are no documents to process for the %1 factory.
There are %1 documents to process for the %2 factory.
Create %1 table indexes. It may take some time...

msg.text: %1 invalid - must be compared equal to 0 or 1
msg.action: Change the portion of the where clause containing PdmInBlackoutWindow() and PdmInMaintenanceWindow() to specify "= 0" or "= 1".

msg.text: Argument 4 of %1(%2) is an invalid year - must be 0, a negative integer, or a positive integer greater than 1900
msg.reason: The fourth argument of PdmToday() is the year adjustment, which must be a negative integer greater than -200 or an explicit year greater than 1900.

msg.text: Argument 3 of %1(%2) is an invalid month - must be 0, a negative integer, or a positive integer from 1 to 12
msg.reason: The third argument of PdmToday() is the month adjustment, which must be a negative integer greater than -200 or an explicit month from 1 to 12.

msg.text: Argument 2 of %1(%2) is an invalid day - must be 0, a negative integer, or a positive integer from 1 to 31
msg.reason: The second argument of PdmToday() is the day adjustment, which must be a negative integer an explicit day from 1 to 31.

msg.text: Time ranges must be entered with earlier time first
msg.action: "You will get this message if you specify a range such as {5:00 pm - 9:00 am}. Enter the earlier time first, such as {9:00 am - 5:00 pm}"
msg.reason: Time range specified a later time first. (Workshift parse error)

msg.action: "This can occur if two date ranges overlap, such as '5/5/96 - 5/10/96' AND '5/8/96 - 5/15/96'. In this example, days 8, 9 and 10 are shared among the two ranges. Change the ranges so there is no overlap, or in the example: '5/5/96 - 5/10/96' AND '5/11/96 - 5/15/96'. See the documentation on Workshifts for instructions and examples."
msg.reason: "Two date ranges overlapped, that is, they both contained one or more of the same days."

msg.action: "This can occur if a date was entered incorrectly, such as '5/5/873' or '5/5'"
msg.reason: A date value was entered incorrectly (Workshift parse error)

msg.action: "This can occur if a time was entered incorrectly, such as '47:00' (goes beyond 24-hour time). It can also occur if a time is missing in a range, such as '{9:00 - }'. See the documentation on Workshifts for correct syntax."
msg.reason: A time value was entered incorrectly (Workshift parse error)

msg.action: "This may occur if a day symbol was entered incorrectly, for instance, 'Fry' instead of 'Fri'. Consult the documentation for Workshifts for all the day symbols."
msg.reason: "This may occur if a day symbol was entered incorrectly, for instance, 'Fry' instead of 'Fri'. Consult the documentation for Workshifts for all the day symbols."

msg.action: The system will usually print out the line and line number (x)of the offending statement. See the documentation for instructions and examples for entering Workshift ranges.
msg.reason: A date/time range was entered incorrectly.

msg.text: Someone else is editing this so you won't be able to make changes
msg.action: Wait until the other user is finished editing the same screen. Or go over to their desk and thump them sharply on the noggin'.
msg.reason: "You are attempting to edit a row in the database, but another user already is currently editing the same row and has the row locked. You will be able to access the information on a read-only version of the form, but you will not be allowed to make updates. msg.action: Verify the NX_ROOT variable is set.
msg.reason: The client could not find the NX.env file. Probably because the NX_ROOT variable was not set in the paradigm.ini file or the NX.env file was deleted.

msg.action: Verify the client is a 4.0 release or better. Try again. Verify the message format has not changed between revisions. Verify the server is running the SW Version Control service.
msg.reason: The client detected an error in the response from the SW Version Control server. This can be caused by an improperly formatted message. If the message was not corrupted during transmission then the server may be a different revision than the client.

msg.text: CA Service Desk Manager is updating your client configuration.
msg.reason: Version control is updating your client configuration. The NX.env may get upgraded and files may be added or deleted.

msg.text: Please reboot your box for updates to take effect.
msg.action: Reboot your box for updates to take effect.
msg.reason: Version control updated a file that is currently in use.

msg.text: No validation returned from server. Is your client the same revision level as the server?
msg.action: Try again. Verify the SW Version Control service is running on the server. Verify the client is pointing to the correct server. Verify the client and server versions are compatible.
msg.reason: The client timed out waiting for the server. The server may be too busy. The SW Version Control service may not be running. Or the message returned from the server was not in the correct format.

msg.text: Version Control is updating your client NX.env file
msg.reason: Version control is updating your NX.env file to reflect changes to the options.

msg.text: \nYour configuration is out of date. Contact your system administrator.
msg.action: Examine the log/client.log file on the client. Verify on the server and client that the failed components are not ver_ctl types. They could be tagged ver_ctl or they may default to ver_ctl if this property is not set. If they are then the user must uplgrade his client manually and edit the default.ver on the client to match the server_default.ver for this component. If this is not the problem then verify the files or directory necessary for the component exists on the server. Verify on the client that user has the correct privileges to change the component.
msg.reason: Version control has detected a difference between the server_default.ver file on the server and the default.ver file on the client that it could not correct.

msg.text: \nWarning: Client is out of configuration. Please see the log/Ver_CTRL.txt and log/client.log files for details.
msg.action: Examine the log/client.log file on the client. Verify on the server and client that the failed components are not ver_ctl types. They could be tagged ver_ctl or they may default to ver_ctl if this property is not set. If they are then the user must upgrade his client manually and edit the default.ver on the client to match the server_default.ver for this component. If this is not the problem then verify the files or directory necessary for the component exists on the server. Verify on the client that user has the correct privileges to change the component.
msg.reason: Version control has detected a difference between the server_default.ver file on the server and the default.ver file on the client that it could not correct. But it is allowing the user to continue because the NX_VER_CTL variable is set to NOTIFY.

msg.text:
Select OK to continue
 or CANCEL to exit.

msg.reason: Version Control has changed your client configuration to match the server.
